title: Ticket #3172: Daemon name validation mis-handles hostname checking
description: When the admin tries to set a daemon's name (e.g. by setting STARTD_NAME), the function build_valid_daemon_name() is used to decide if the final name should be <name>@<hostname>, <name>, or <hostname>. If the name the admin is trying to set matches the hostname, then we just use the hostname. But the comparison in build_valid_daemon_name() is flipped. As a result, when the admin sets the name to be the hostname, then the final result is <hostname>@<hostname>, and if the admin sets anything else that looks like a hostname (i.e. it contains a '.'), then the result is <hostname> (the admin's name is ignored).
